paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel pathogenic BRCA2 mutation (c.4211C>G, p.Ser1404Ter) in a patient with prostate cancer, along with additional benign polymorphisms.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In May 2011, a 46-year-old Chinese man with dysuria lasting for 6 months was referred to Daping Hospital of the Third Military Medical University.

functional_data.summary: The mutation results in a truncated protein, leading to loss of function.

variants.additional_notes: This is the first report of this specific BRCA2 mutation in a patient with prostate cancer.
key_quotes: To our knowledge, we are the first to report the germline BRCA2 mutation c.4211C>G (p.Ser1404Ter) in prostate cancer.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Analysis of peripheral blood also identified benign polymorphisms in BRCA2 (c.7397T>C, p.Val2466Ala).

functional_data.summary: Identified as a benign polymorphism with no significant impact on protein function.

variants.additional_notes: This variant is considered benign and does not contribute to disease risk.
key_quotes: Analysis of peripheral blood also identified benign polymorphisms in BRCA2 (c.7397T>C, p.Val2466Ala).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted from the main text.
